Others: The Golden State Warriors beat the New Orleans Pelicans for the second straight night, 104-89 on Wednesday.
Stephen Curry missed his second straight game with a left ankle injury.
Andrew Wiggins also sat out consecutive nights because of low back tightness.
Buddy Hield scored 21 points for the short-handed Pelicans.
Jordan Hawkins had 23 points for the Pelicans.
Trayce Jackson-Davis had 15 points and nine rebounds for the Warriors.
Draymond Green had 14 points and six assists.
Zion Williamson was held to 12 points on 5-for-20 shooting to go with 12 rebounds.
The Warriors had to play from behind most of Tuesday's contest, but started fast by making 12 of 23 shots (52.2%) to go ahead 28-20.
The Pelicans were without guards CJ McCollum and Herb Jones.
McCollum will have imaging done on his sore right adductor muscle and Jones also underwent imaging tests.
The Warriors exercised the third-year contract option on second-year guard Brandin Podziemski.
The Pelicans host Indiana on Friday to begin a four-game homestand, while Golden State hits the road for five games beginning Saturday at Houston.
Their next home game Nov. 12 will mark the return of Klay Thompson with the Mavericks.
